sentences.sContent: The firm went bankrupt before the building work was completed.
sentences.sCn: 建筑工程尚未竣工，公司就破产了。

sentences.sContent: In 1977 he was declared bankrupt (=  by a court  ) .
Mr Trent lost his house when he was made bankrupt .
sentences.sCn: 特伦特先生破产以后房子也没有了。

sentences.sContent: Seventeen years of war left the country bankrupt.
The move to the market nearly bankrupted the firm and its director.
sentences.sCn: 走向市场的行动几乎使这家公司及其董事破产。

sentences.sContent: Johns had been nearly bankrupted through a failed business venture.
sentences.sCn: 约翰斯因为商业投资失败几近破产。

sentences.sContent: In total, 80% of bankrupts are men.
sentences.sCn: 总体来看，有80%的破产者为男性。

remMethod.val: bank(银行)+rupt(断裂)→在银行里的资金链断裂了→破产的

trans.tranOther: without enough money to pay what you owe
To bankrupt a person or organization means to make them go bankrupt
someone who has officially said that they cannot pay their debts
